<dummy>The skies over Naggaroth are stained crimson, for the Blood God's gaze has fallen upon the heavily fortified cities of the Dark Elves. Driven by countless turbid visions placed in his mind by Khorne, the Bloodbeast will not stop until all of Naggaroth is his blood-ground.

<dummy>The Slaughterhorn leads his tribe south through the forests of Naggaroth and into the jungles of Lustria, driven ever onwards by portentious visions whispered in his primitive mind by the Ruinous Powers.

<dummy>The exact location of this place is never spoken of, but the Bray-Shamans claim that all beastpaths ultimately lead toward it. At its centre is the mightiest herdstone in the whole of the world, resonating with a malignant power that Taurox vows will be his to harness.

<dummy>There are those who would stand against your ascension. Your Father-in-Shadow schemes against you on Albion, the upstart "Godslayer" means to challenge your reign, and the Red Tzar oversteps his bounds, leading an expedition deep into the Chaos Wastes. They will all bend the knee, or they will all die.

<dummy>Commander of the Swordfysh, a mighty galleon crewed by hundreds, Aranessa and her crew prefer boarding actions to thundering broadsides. The ship roves the Tilean Sea and beyond, raiding and pillaging any who cross her path. Make them all fear the crossed tridents upon her sails.

<dummy>Rumour has it that saltwater flows through her veins instead of blood. That she rose fully grown from the waves in a froth of gore. The truth, unknown to most, is not so magnificent - Aranessa was born a mutant in Skjold and thrown into the sea by her own Norscan tribe. Her crews and victims alike believe Manann, Lord of the Seas, watches over her, and the seas rage as the Swordfysh sails into the wealthiest ports.\\n
<dummy>“Sartosa burned and we fled, but a mighty vengeance was born in us that day. Your death did not dull my spirit. You'll have your vengeance, Jaego. I swear it.”

<dummy>Miao's sister, [[url:#]]Shen-Zoo[[/url]], [[url:#]]Dragon of Light[[/url]], was last seen venturing beyond the mountains of Norsca before her disappearance. <dummy>Miao Ying gathers a great host under her banner, drawing from all the levies within the Northern Provinces. For too long she has safeguarded the Great Bastion, repelling countless incursions, yet denied every chance at reprisal. The Jade Dragon denounces his sister's reckless ambition, but his protestations are dismissed as yet another storm in a teacup. The north wind blows strongly, a clear omen of war and glory. Who is he to deny prophecy?

<dummy>“My siblings resent me, thinking me favoured for I am the eldest. They envy my station. They are wrong! I am cursed with responsibility, the ultimate responsibility... Should I fail and the Bastion falls, then Cathay is doomed, and they will be jealous of nothing but a wasteland!”

<dummy>At the Tower of Ashshair, Zhao Ming once came to an agreement with Greasus Goldtooth: Cathay's caravans would have safe passage through the Ogre's lands, as long as a toll was paid. In the years since that bargain was struck, Greasus has risen to the rank of Overtyrant - leader of the Ogre Kingdoms, and his tolls have become increasingly exorbitant. The Iron Dragon must rein in the gluttonous Ogre's excesses, or else abandon all pretenses of diplomacy and secure the Ivory Road by force of arms.

<dummy>Though the Ivory Road reaps enormous profits, it is also used to exert influence over foreign powers and further Cathay's interests abroad. In Shang-Yang, the largest city in the Western Provinces, weary merchants and envoys are provided with every comfort and showered with luxurious gifts, thus ensuring they are more amenable to the Dragon Emperor's demands.

<dummy>The strange elements found in the Warpstone Desert have only deepened Zhao's fascination with alchemy. Having ascertained the location of hoards of warpstone abroad, the Iron Dragon feels he now has enough information to launch an expedition into the west.

<dummy>To ensure the safety of caravans travelling through Gnoblar Country, the Iron Dragon must do battle with zombies from the Haunted Forest, Chaos Dwarf slavers from the Black Fortress, and even the infamous Nurglite daemon Zin-Fa the Ever-Pustulent. Since his defeat by Zhao and his brothers at Shang-Wu, Ku'gath has returned to the mortal realm and now plagues the Dragon Isles.

<dummy>The Legion of Azgorh have abandoned their previous arrangement with the Iron Dragon and now brazenly attack his caravans from their stronghold of Black Fortress. They will soon learn the folly of their actions.

<dummy>“Gods of Chaos... I have tasted but a morsel of your power... Look at what I have achieved! Let me feast upon it! Kislev will be mine, and together, we will serve you. Bestow me with your terrible grace!”
<dummy>The so-called "Everchosen" presumptuously commands you to serve in his armies. The Godslayer answers to no one! Archaon must be taught a lesson in humility.
<dummy>The Red Tzar, Boris Ursus, stands against you. His faith in the false god Ursun is not a strength, but a weakness. One that you will easily exploit.
<dummy>Be'lakor... the betrayer. Through unknown means he has achieved physical form once more and now doubtless plots against you on the Isle of Albion. Banish him back to the shadows.

<dummy>“The Dark Brothers mean to crown some spineless southerner as Everchosen, leader of all the armies of Chaos. Fools! They will know their folly when they bear witness to my trail of destruction. From east to west, all will fear my name!”
<dummy>“Ursun has forsaken you. He has forsaken Kislev! Give yourselves fully to the Dark Brothers. Only through their strength will we find salvation!”

<dummy>Dawn rises, and a great brass gong rings out, signalling the end of the charnel madness that is Death Night. As Hellebron submerges herself in her Cauldron of Blood, she is blessed with a vision from her murderous god. She sees herself at the head of a mighty host marching deep into the Chaos Wastes, cutting down scores of daemons and northmen in glorious battle. This vision must be made manifest.

<dummy>Like the lice-ridden scalp of a wretched slave, Naggaroth writhes with invaders. Clearly, the Witch King's presence no longer commands the fear and respect it once did. No matter. They will learn to fear the Blood Queen instead.

<dummy>Morathi's position is precarious. Her son banished her to Quintex, and now he is beset by foes from all sides. Perhaps the time has finally come for Hellebron to rid herself of her most hated rival?

<dummy>To the east, Khaine calls, and Hellebron, his bride, is drawn to answer. Mustering a vast army of blood-crazed Druchii, she sets off on a grand [[col:red]]Blood Voyage[[/col]] destined for Ulthuan. She will not rest until the Sword of Khaine is drenched in the [[col:green]]Everqueen[[/col]]'s blood!

<dummy>Gotrek Starbreak declared the grudge against the Elves settled when he took the Phoenix Crown from their king's broken corpse, but Grombrindal knew that was not the end of the matter. He knew the one truly responsible had not yet paid for his crimes. The one who once swore eternal friendship between elf and dwarf. The one who now called himself 'Witch King'.

<dummy>Fell forces now gather against Elves and Dwarfs. Malekith, embittered by his maiming in the Flame of Asuryan, seeks to destroy them both, but still darker powers are also at work. Already strained, disharmony sours relations between them until only enmity remains. Will the White Dwarf stoke the fires of war, or will he douse them instead?

<dummy>The White Dwarf led his Ancestral Throng across the Boiling Sea and onto the shores of Naggaroth. Those who answered his call know they march with a Living Ancestor and stand ready with hammer and shield to bring ruin to their foes in these bleak lands.

<dummy>A mysterious [[col:subtitle_kugath]]plague[[/col]] spreads from the north. [[col:subtitle_greasus]]Beastmen[[/col]] prey upon the Emperor's loyal subjects within the Drakwald forest. [[col:subtitle_kairos_future]]Marienburg[[/col]]'s secession drains the imperial coffers on a daily basis. Barely recovered from his most recent skirmish with the Greenskins at Black Fire Pass, [[col:red]]Karl Franz[[/col]] readies the men for a new campaign to unite the western provinces of his Empire.

<dummy>Grim tidings make their way from the east. Despite his apparent death beneath the ramparts of Altdorf many years ago, the vampire [[col:subtitle_miao_ying]]Vlad von Carstein[[/col]] has returned. While he musters his legion of the dead, malicious tree spirits gather in the [[col:subtitle_skrag]]Gryphon Wood[[/col]], slaughtering good citizens of the Empire without rhyme or reason, and disturbing reports of [[col:magic]]doppelganger[[/col]] activity continue to plague Stirland.  This cannot stand. [[col:red]]Karl Franz[[/col]] orders his men east to put down these new threats to his reign once and for all.

<dummy>[[col:subtitle_miao_ying]]Archaon the Everchosen[[/col]] has united the warring tribes of the north and now marches south with the largest host ever seen in living memory. In response, [[col:red]]Karl Franz[[/col]] sends his emissaries across the Known World. He will assemble a grand council of war, a [[col:fe_white]]Conclave of Light[[/col]], to stand against the coming darkness.

<dummy>After a spate of recent attacks against the colonists in the New World, Karl Franz has called upon his Captain of Scouts, Markus Wulfhart, to defend the Empire's holdings and reaffirm their foothold on this beast-infested continent. From his newly established base camp on the Scorpion Coast, the Huntsmarshal readies his expedition for their imminent incursion into the jungle.

<dummy>After making common cause with the [[col:ancillary_uncommon]]Amazonian Sisterhood[[/col]] at the [[col:yellow]]Temple of Kara[[/col]], one of their number spoke of an ancient Saurian weapon of dread power: [[col:yellow]]The No'Tidoq Artifact[[/col]]. The Lizardmen, for reasons known only to them, have split the artifact into three pieces and sealed them within heavily-warded vaults across Lustria.

<dummy>The Lustrian jungles are teeming with some of the most ferocious beasts in the known world. While lesser men would run horrified at the mere sight of these creatures, the Huntsmarshal merely steadies his bow and aims for the killing strike.
<dummy>“Everfing I see is mine. All da uvver bits are mine too - I just ain't got there yet. When we reach da end of da whole world, we'll turn around and march back.”

<dummy>Long ago, the Chaos Dwarfs carefully bred enslaved Greenskins to create a new subspecies: the Black Orc. They sought to make them stronger, hardier and more intelligent - the perfect slaves. They succeeded on all counts, but one...
<dummy>Grimgor has returned to Karak Kadrin, this time with a colossal battering ram forged by captured Daemonsmiths from the Dark Lands. The stunties are going to need a bigger gate...

<dummy>Grimgor's last attempt to take Kislev was thwarted when the Ice Queen repelled his assault with a massive blizzard. This time he comes prepared. A captured Imperial Pyromancer, his mind addled with madcap mushrooms, will keep the ice at bay.

<dummy>Grimgor abandoned his last siege of Hell Pit when he grew bored of slaughtering the poor sport sent against him, but rumour has it that Throt the Unclean has crafted more powerful beasts in his fleshlabs. Such a challenge cannot go ignored...

<dummy>Prince Tyrion is the Defender of Ulthuan and the protector of its people, a heavy burden entrusted to him by the Phoenix King Finubar. Among the Dark Elves of Naggaroth he is known as the Reaper, to the Goblins of Red-Axe Pass he is Orcbane, and to the north the Norse know him as Mankiller. For two centuries he has stood between the Elves of Ulthuan and their many foes as an unbreakable shield against the darkness.
<dummy>Malekith's ruinous ambitions have brought death and destruction to Ulthuan for centuries. Elf has fought against elf for far too long. The civil war must end.

<dummy>Tyrion concerns himself only with the twin duties of protecting Ulthuan and its Everqueen, the beloved Alarielle. However, the latter is seen less as a duty than it is a calling of the heart - it is common knowledge that Tyrion is Alarielle's consort, and has been for many years.

<dummy>The fate of Tyrion's soul teeters on a blade-edge. Will he succumb to Aenarion's curse and salve his people's wounded pride with the blood of old enemies, or will he put aside those grievances and reforge old alliances to stand together against the forces of Chaos?

<dummy>During times of utter destruction and murder, Khorne's bellows resound in the Chaos Wastes, causing madness in any that might hear. Of all the Ruinous Powers, Khorne is the biggest instigator of war and destruction. He will not rest until all the world is drowned in fire and blood.

<dummy>To the east is Lahmia, the Cursed City, birthplace of the vampires. Let their tainted blood drench the desert sands. To the south are great champions of order whose deaths will doubtless please Khorne greatly. Let their blood flow. These parched lands beg for a crimson flood. We shall quench their thirst!

<dummy>Though Khorne cares not from whence the blood flows, the tainted blood of Vampires is much sought after by his mortal followers, Minotaurs in particular. To indulge one's bloodthirst with such a heady brew always promises grand mutation, and who is Skarbrand to deny his followers such a gift? Taking up his gore-encrusted axes, the Exiled One leads his host into the lands of Sylvania and beyond. Let there be blood!
<dummy>Within the dunes of Araby lie Tomb Kings and holy crusaders who stand against you. Their skulls will make a mighty offering to your hateful god.

<dummy>Khorne most despises Slaanesh, whose dark designs are an affront to the Blood God's sense of honour and martial pride. The Exiled One shares this hatred for the Dark Prince's followers. He has no time for pleasure or eroticism; indeed, all such emotions have been purged long ago, leaving only rage, hate and the desire for vengeance. He will reap their skulls for the Skull Throne.

<dummy>Urskin has the traitor-prince's scent, and so the hunt begins. The trail leads west, where Boris must do battle with depraved servants of Slaanesh, sadistic Elves and scores of daemons who haunt these desolate wastes.

<dummy>Boris' reign was a bloody one, marked by constant siege and endless war. He will not watch his daughter share that same fate. He marches north, an army of Orthodoxy loyalists following his banner. For the first time in Kislev's long history, it will be safe from the daemons... for they will be far too busy with him.

<dummy>Boris rides out into the wastes to face down the greatest champions of the Dark Gods and avert the prophesied End Times. In the Badlands, he does battle with black-hearted Dwarfs and their Greenskin thralls. Every foe vanquished is one less threat to the Motherland.

<dummy>In days long past, Kislev's borders once extended as far as the Eastern Steppes. Decades of conflict with Hobgoblins, Fire Dwarfs and Ogres forced the old Tzars to concede much of this territory. Boris believes the glory days of old Kislev can be restored. He leads his armies into the Dark Lands, to reclaim that which was taken.
<dummy>The Red Tzar faces a difficult decision. Does he support his daughter's rule and condemn the Orthodoxy he has worked so hard to build, or does he renounce his blood and stay true to the faith?

<dummy>The Ice Queen leads a fractured nation, under threat from forces both without and within. Kostaltyn, the de facto leader of the Great Orthodoxy, instigates rebellion from his stronghold on the west coast. His sermons were well-received by the Ropsmenn Clan, who have risen out of the ghettos of Praag to take control of the city. These zealots must be pacified before they cause a schism from which the Motherland will never recover.

<dummy>The Motherland is beset by foes on all sides, but it is the Godslayer that Katarin most fears - he who once threatened the life of Ursun himself. Once her childhood friend and secret lover, Kislev's fallen son has returned from his doomed expedition, seeking to finish what he started.

<dummy>“You look down on us and think we are little better than barbarians, but you should be glad we are, for without us here, the northern tribes would be dining on the flesh of your children in your burning homes. But for the courage that flows in our veins would your lands be theirs. Look down on us? You should be on your knees, thanking us every day!”

The Ice Queen will lead our mighty nation into ruin with her dangerous magicks. She'd already be screaming on a pyre if she did not share the Red Tzar's blood. Nevertheless, Kostaltyn must act. If he wins the support of the people, the Tzarina will have no choice but to relenquish her frozen grip on these lands.

<dummy>The Supreme Patriarch knows without a shadow of a doubt that the only thing that stands between his people and annihilation is faith. A bright reflection of the agents of darkness, he sees the land and its people as what he must protect and serve.

<dummy>The Old World is rife with corruption, blasphemy, and the worship of lesser gods. Tear down the Temple of Sigmar, disperse the Cult of Ulric, beggar the followers of Handrich! Ursun, Tor, Dazh, Salyak – these are the true gods who will guide the realms of men out of chaos, no others!

<dummy>The Lizardmen must accomplish the first of the Old Ones' decrees - the extermination of those races not part of the [[col:yellow]]Great Plan[[/col]]. [[col:yellow]]Mazdamundi[[/col]] believes it is pointless to divine the next stages until the first is complete; to do so would only invite further error.

<dummy>After centuries of contemplation, the great [[col:yellow]]Mazdamundi[[/col]] has fully bestirred himself, shaking off the lethargy that has afflicted so many of his kind. He seeks to restore the fractured [[col:yellow]]Geomantic Web[[/col]] and unite all the Lizardmen under his Sunburst Standard. To do so, the warhosts of the Solar City will have to conquer or pacify the nations that have risen up over the ancient sites of [[col:yellow]]Geomantic Nexuses[[/col]].

<dummy>“Woe to the warm-bloods who trespass against us. Feed them to the beasts of the jungle and leave their bones to bleach upon the golden shores of our land. Let them see that it is folly to intrude upon the [[col:ancillary_crafted]]Isthmus[[/col]].”

If Lustria is to endure, the [[col:yellow]]Geomantic Web[[/col]] linking [[col:ancillary_crafted]]Hexoatl[[/col]] and [[col:ancillary_crafted]]Itza[[/col]] must be re-established. Seek an [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]]alliance with the [[col:fe_white]]Great White Lizard[[/col]] or seize the [[col:ancillary_crafted]]First City[[/col]] directly.
<dummy>The End Times are nigh. Wulfrik has long cursed the gods for his predicament, but now realises he must pledge himself to one of them if he is to survive the coming apocalypse.
<dummy>After a drunken boast made in sight of the Dark Gods, Wulfrik was cursed to forever wander the earth and seek out the fiercest challengers and slay them in single combat.

The Norse adventurer Losteriksson was the first Norscan to land on the coast of Lustria and live to tell the tale. The settlement he founded still stands to this day, though it is under dire threat from the Lizardmen of the jungle. Occupy the following region:

<dummy>The time has come for Wulfrik to rise as chieftan of all of Norsca. There will be many challengers who will seek to hold control of their own tribes. Slay them all, and offer their blood up to the Seafang!

<dummy>The Plague Lord, obsessed with his ceaseless foetid experiments, seems to care little about the Great Game. Yet his carefree demeanour subtly undermines the plotting and politicking of the other Chaos Gods. It drives Khorne to an unthinking fury, disturbs Tzeentch's insidious train of thought, and distracts Slaanesh from his indulgences. Meanwhile, Nurgle's own intrigues spread slowly like a cancer.

<dummy>Ku'gath journeys east, eager to discover new reagents in the exotic jungles of Cathay. But first, an unexpected foe bars his passage: Helman Ghorst. He who shunned the Urfarther's gift of the Blue Roses. The Plaguefather is most intrigued by this individual and wishes to test his susceptibility to his more recent creations.

<dummy>Ku'gath journeys east, eager to discover new reagents in the exotic jungles of Cathay. The Plagueweaver must exercise caution, for the vexatious Cathayan Dragons patrol the skies, and their flaming breath is anathema to Chaos.

<dummy>The Urfather's plagues have always failed to propagate through Kislev, as the freezing cold and sparsely-populated oblasts are poor conditions for germs to thrive. Ku'gath toiled for months at his cauldron, unable to solve the problem, until a captured Ice Witch was brought before him. Her blood proved to be the missing ingredient he had been searching for. Now, all that remains is to test this new creation...

<dummy>It is during forays into the Known World that Ku'gath has encountered the one mortal race that has penetrated his scientific detachment to kindle his rage - the Dwarfs. On a professional level, the Plaguefather hates the creatures for their resilience to disease; on a personal level, he is embittered by a truly ignominious defeat beneath the walls of Karaz-a-Karak. Either way, there is no doubt in Ku'gath's mind as to the first test subjects when his perfect plague is prepared.

<dummy>The Goldtooth tribe is notorious for its wealth. Ever eager to show off their top status, they are given to ostentatious displays - from a vast mountaintop feast hall, to gem-encrusted gutplates and even a solid gold Mawtooth. Now, under the rule of Greasus, the tribe will grow richer still.

<dummy>Greasus' overflowing coffers have not diminished his greed nor his all-consuming desire to conquer everything he sees. The Tribestealer will unite the Ogres of the Mountains of Mourn into the largest Ogre Kingdom in history!
<dummy>The Black Orc known as Grimgor Ironhide seeks to challenge Greasus' reign, brazenly dubbing himself "Boss of the East". The Sceptre of Titans will disabuse him of this notion.

<dummy>Maintaining strong ties with the Cathayans will ensure their wealth continues to flow into the Hoardmaster's coffers. Alternatively, Greasus could move against their draconic masters directly; after all, they don't call him Drakecrush for nothing.

<dummy>As Skrag feeds the bloody corpse of a Sartosan Vampire into his maw-cauldron, he is suddenly overcome with an all-consuming vision. A gaping whirlpool in the centre of the ocean, ravenously devouring the very lifeblood of the earth. His curiosity piqued, the Maw-that-Walks leads his tribe on a dangerous pilgrimage to seek out this new god.

<dummy>Skrag journeys east, making his long pilgrimage back to the Great Maw. He means to deliver to his god the greatest tribute of all - the flesh of the bear god, Ursun. But first, preparations must be made.

<dummy>Skrag leads his ravenous tribe west, through the lands of the Southern Realms and into the verdant pastures of Bretonnia. Though there are many foes on this journey, soon to become meat for the maw-cauldron, there are many potential allies as well.

<dummy>Guided by the Great Maw, Skrag has travelled far from the Ogre Kingdoms. He follows visions given to him by his ravenous god - visions that show the Empire awash in blood and gore, their populace fit only for meat for the cookpots. The Gore-Harvester will not rest until this reality is made manifest!

<dummy>The Gorgers grow tired of the scrawny Border Princes and hunger for new prey. In the Badlands, the Dwarfs and Greenskins fight for dominance. Their well-marbled forms would undoubtedly roast up well in the maw-cauldron. To the west, through Black Fire Pass, the lands of the Empire are ripe for plunder, and the cloying scent of vampiric blood wafts from the north. Skrag closes his eyes and prays to the God Mouth for guidance.

As a show of strength for his political rivals, he means to restore the [[col:red]]Dawi-Zharr Warfleet[[/col]] to its former glory. To do so, he must secure the entirety of the [[col:ancillary_crafted]]River Ruin[[/col]].

<dummy>The [[col:dark_r]]Black Fortress[[/col]] stands as a bulwark against frequent incursions from ogres, daemons, undead and more besides. Drazhoath must quell these threats via political machinations or force of arms before he can begin his conquests in the east.

<dummy>The Legion of Azgorh marches east, intent on swelling the ranks of their labourers with Cathay's vast population. Yet the [[col:subtitle_zhao_ming]]Iron Dragon[[/col]] has safeguarded the [[col:subtitle_zhao_ming]]Western Provinces[[/col]] for centuries. Drazhoath must fight fire with fire and pit the dragon’s flame against Hashut’s own.

<dummy>Drazhoath means to achieve his greatest conquest yet. A feat of such significance that all his rivals in [[col:dark_r]]Zharr-Naggrund[[/col]] will have no choice but to recognise his supremacy. He leads the Legion of Azgorh on a long march west, to [[col:ancillary_rare]]Karaz-a-Karak[[/col]], the heart of the Karaz Ankor and seat of the High King, [[col:ancillary_rare]]Thorgrim Grudgebearer[[/col]].

<dummy>The Warhost of Zharr marches east, intent on breaching the [[col:subtitle_miao_ying]]Great Bastion[[/col]] and relieving the dragon-spawn of their overabundance of labourers. Zhatan’s goals are more personal. He means to see the [[col:subtitle_miao_ying]]Storm Dragon[[/col]] dead by his hand and her legendary [[col:subtitle_valkia]]forges[[/col]] retasked to his cause.

<dummy>Zhatan laughs cruelly as the Daemonette howls with every whip of his lash. His laughter abruptly stops, however, when he realises the daemon is enjoying the sensation. It is sent to the depths of Uzkulak for three days and returned to Zhatan’s presence, now much more pliable. It hurriedly divulges the information Zhatan desires: the location of the [[col:subtitle_azazel]]Marcher Fortress[[/col]].

Within [[col:subtitle_valkia]]Dark Fortresses[[/col]] throughout the [[col:dark_r]]Chaos Wastes[[/col]] are rifts to the [[col:dark_r]]Realms of Chaos[[/col]]. Sorcerer-Prophets will ascertain whether they lead to the [[col:subtitle_azazel]]Marcher Fortress[[/col]], but first they must be secured via [[img:sword_of_khaine]][[/img]]conquest or through [[img:icon_vassal]][[/img]]vassals and [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]]military allies:

The Sorcerer-Prophets will co-opt these arcane portals and ascertain whether they lead to the [[col:subtitle_azazel]]Marcher Fortress[[/col]], but first they must be secured via [[img:sword_of_khaine]][[/img]]conquest or through [[img:icon_vassal]][[/img]]vassals and [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]]military allies:

<dummy>The Conclave have entrusted Zhatan with pacifying the [[col:subtitle_greasus]]Ogres[[/col]] of the [[col:subtitle_greasus]]Mountains of Mourn[[/col]], who have become far too belligerent as of late. The dull brutes must be taught a lesson in respect. Though many will doubtless capitulate to our might, some will need to be dealt with more forcefully.

<dummy>The Black Orc Rebellion is a source of much shame for the Chaos Dwarfs. Zhatan means to restore his nation’s pride by defeating the legendary Black Orc [[col:subtitle_festus]]Grimgor Ironhide[[/col]] in single combat and enslaving his followers for further experimentation. He will succeed where all other Dawi-Zharr have failed.

<dummy>Zhatan orders his [[col:subtitle_valkia]]Convoys[[/col]] forth into the [[col:dark_r]]Chaos Wastes[[/col]], seeking out those who would be willing to barter arms and armour for gold and labourers. Above all, however, he hungers for a fresh supply of daemons to feed his forges. Though some will be easy prey for his binding rituals, others will yield only to force.

<dummy>Drazhoath means to achieve his greatest conquest yet. A feat of such significance that all his rivals in [[col:dark_r]]Zharr-Naggrund[[/col]] will have no choice but to recognise his supremacy. He leads the Legion of Azgorh on a long march west, to [[col:ancillary_rare]]Karak Kadrin[[/col]], birthplace of the famed Slayers and seat of the Slayer King, [[col:ancillary_rare]]Ungrim Ironfist[[/col]].
<dummy>From the Imperial colony of Sudenburg, the Grand Theogonist leads his devout followers on a holy war against the forces of corruption, heresy and death in these arid lands.
<dummy>“The Daemons of Chaos can be likened to hungry and rabid wolves. The shepherd should not waste time hating the wolf that attacks his flock. He should simply kill it.”

<dummy>Under the Grand Theogonist's guidance, the Cult of Sigmar journeys across the world to seek out the [[[col:subtitle_daemon_prince]]Books of Nagash[[/col]]. These accursed tomes must be sealed away for all time, lest they fall into the hands of the Empire's enemies.

<dummy>After his failure to steal Ursun's godly strength, Be'lakor flew on wings of shadow to the far-flung isle of Albion. There, he harvested the energies of that mystic isle to weave himself a new body. Now, with the [[col:ancillary_unique]]Shadow Rifts[[/col]] at his disposal, he stands ready to besiege the mortal world once more.

<dummy>As the hour of the thirteenth coronation draws near, Be'lakor is driven as never before to throw off his shackles. He will lay low the Chaos Gods' greatest champions. This time, the daemonic legions will march not at the whims of the thirteenth Everchosen, Archaon, but in accordance with his own plans, whether the Chaos Gods wish it or no.
<dummy>Be'lakor leads his legions through the [[col:ancillary_unique]]Shadow Rifts[[/col]], searching for cursed souls and fell arcana to power a mysterious new creation within the Forge of Souls.

Harvest the following settlements via [[img:sword_of_khaine]][[/img]]conquest or through [[img:icon_vassal]][[/img]]vassals and [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]]military allies until the [[col:dark_r]]Aetherophasic Engine[[/col]] activates:

<dummy>For centuries, the [[col:ancillary_rare]]Dwarfs[[/col]] and [[col:ancillary_uncommon]]Greenskins[[/col]] waged eternal war, each vying for supremacy over these arid lands. As thousands of carrion birds descended upon the aftermath of one especially bloody battle, a black shape coalesced within their midst. The Crowfather emerged, and with a single undulating bellow, he called his herds to war.

<dummy>To all of humanity, Malagor is a harbinger of the downfall of all they hold dear. Vilified by the [[col:yellow]]Cult of Sigmar[[/col]] as the epitome of sin due to his many blasphemies, the [[col:yellow]]Grand Theogonist[[/col]] leads a coalition of nations against the Harbinger. They will fail.

<dummy>One night, when the dark moon waxed full in the sky, Malagor's mind was flooded with whispers from the Dark Gods. They commanded him to lead his warherd into the blighted lands of the undead, tear down their necropolises, and smash their parched bones to powder. Malagor knew not the reasons for their instructions, but their motivations mattered little to him - the gods had commanded, and he would obey.

<dummy>Though Tretch’s Raiders regularly patrol the [[col:dark_r]]Dark Lands[[/col]] in search of [[col:green]]Warpstone Meteor[[/col]] impact craters, the overland journey is fraught with peril. The Grey Seers claim to have devised a method of influencing their trajectories, but to do so, they will need access to the following locations:

<dummy>Kratch Doomclaw, Supreme Warlord of Clan Rictus, commands his Grand Chieftain of the Deep Warrens to lead a vermintide into the [[col:fe_white]]Worlds Edge Mountains[[/col]]. Kratch no doubt believes he will finally be rid of his irksome subordinate, but Tretch has a habit of turning such situations to his advantage...

<dummy>[[col:yellow]]Fozzrik's Flying Fortress[[/col]], an ancient arcane castle imbued with all eight Winds of Magic, descends from the clouds and makes landfall in the Badlands for the first time in centuries. Its capture would grant Clan Rictus much prestige across Skavendom.\\n

<dummy>Clan Mors has long been a fierce rival of Clan Rictus, as both lead what are considered to be the two greatest Warlord Clans of Skavendom. This status quo has run its course. There can be only one!

<dummy>At the request of the Dragon Emperor, the Jade Dragon is tasked with a plan centuries in the making. He must journey to nexus points in the [[col:subtitle_kairos_future]]Geomantic Web[[/col]] and construct relays to empower the [[col:subtitle_kairos_past]]Wu Xing Compass[[/col]]. Though none save his progenitors know the full extent of this plan, Yuan Bo is a dutiful son and embarks without question.

<dummy>A hooded crone approaches Yuan Bo from the shadows, but in the light of the full moon her true form is revealed: it is his mother, the Moon Empress, Quai Yin. She speaks of prophecy and destiny. The End Times approach, and Grand Cathay teeters on the precipice of ruin. The time has come: this fractured empire must be made whole once more.

<dummy>To his siblings, Yuan Bo is dismissed as a mere bureaucrat, administrator and scribe. To his enemies, he is feared as a mighty warrior and sorcerer without peer. Yet it is his vast network of spies and informants that are the true source of his power and influence. With a whispered word, the Crowmen take flight.

<dummy>[[col:subtitle_spirits]]Mother Ostankya[[/col]], long thought a myth, has emerged from the forests of Kislev to bring terror and destruction to her enemies. Her coven ranges out far from Kislev's borders, seeking [[col:subtitle_spirits]]Spirit Essence[[/col]] in order to unleash the earth-shattering power of the [[col:subtitle_spirits]]Malediction of Ruin[[/col]].

<dummy>The Daughters of the Forest venture south, into the sweltering jungles of Lustria. They seek three ingredients for a powerful new concoction: [[img:ui/campaign ui/effect_bundles/vco_itxi_grubs.png]][[/img]][[col:daemon_prince]]Itxi Grubs[[/col]], rumoured to be swollen with magical energies; [[img:ui/campaign ui/effect_bundles/vco_jungle_lotus.png]][[/img]][[col:green]]Jungle Lotus Leaves[[/col]], a plant so rare that an entire caste of Skinks is dedicated to locating and harvesting it; and [[img:ui/campaign ui/effect_bundles/vco_coatl_feather.png]][[/img]][[col:ancillary_rare]]Coatl Feathers[[/col]], vibrant with an ancient mystical power that permeates the continent.

<dummy>After a perilous journey across the Great Ocean, a splinter faction of Kislevites have established a humble colony on the shores of Naggaroth. Their prospects are bleak, but, unbeknownst to them, the Daughters of the Forest have come to their aid. For this nascent nation to prosper, they must banish the shadow of Chaos from its soil.

<dummy>Rampaging daemons and bloodthirsty northmen continue to threaten the people of Kislev, with their forays from the Chaos Wastes growing in both frequency and savagery. It is time to give them something to fear in their own lands. Make their armies bleed, until tales of your sorcery take root in their nightmares. Only then will the Motherland prosper.

<dummy>There is only one being who could be the subject of the final, ultimate scheme. The greatest prank you've ever devised. This will be your magnum opus. You just need to assemble the correct pieces...

<dummy>The Changeling sends his cultists out across the world to spread the first seeds of Chaos. Overtyrant, Phoenix King, Royarch... Tzeentch's Trickster has donned these honorifics countless times throughout history, and he will do so again.

<dummy>It is said that the elusive [[col:fe_white]]Moon Empress[[/col]] taught her progeny the art of taking human form, and, indeed, is quite the shapeshifter herself. Her mere existence pricks the Changeling's pride and goads him into reckless action. Savaging her children will surely lure her out, and then we shall see who is foremost amongst the formless!\\n\\n
Conquer at least 6 of the following regions either by direct ownership or through [[img:icon_vassal]][[/img]]vassals and [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]]military allies:

<dummy>Under Lord Mazdamundi's guidance, Nakai leads the Spirits of the Jungle through the Paths of the Old Ones, emerging in the southern jungles of Cathay. The Great Plan is clear: he must reawaken the long dormant [[col:yellow]]Geomantic Web[[/col]] in these lands.

<dummy>Lustria is and always has been the dominion of the Lizardmen, but now the warmbloods encroach upon sacred land, their plundering presence an affront to the Great Plan. With a swarm of his faithful kin following in his wake, Nakai instinctively senses a struggle of great importance is coming. It is time for the greed of the 'civilised' to be met with all the savagery of the jungle.

<dummy>The foremost servants of the Ancient Enemy have manifested in the material realm. Death and corruption follow in their wake, and their very presence is an unacceptable interference in the Great Plan. Nakai leads his host across the World Pond, bringing ruin to the enemy wherever they are found.
<dummy>A [[col:subtitle_kugath]]Great Unclean One[[/col]] brings plague and pestilence to the savage Saurus of the Dragon Isles. They will likely succumb without Nakai's intervention.

<dummy>A [[col:dark_r]]Bloodthirster[[/col]] marches on the Southlands, leaving rivers of blood and shattered bone in his wake. The Last Defender and Master of Skies move to intercept him. They will not stand alone.

<dummy>As He Who Hunts Unseen challenges a two-headed [[col:magic]]Lord of Change[[/col]] in the heart of the Southern Chaos Wastes, Nakai and his warhost emerge from the depths of a Silent Sanctum, ready to do battle.

<dummy>At Lord Mazdamundi's urging, Nakai journeys to the Isle of Ulthuan. His goal is simple: destroy a [[col:subtitle_nkari]]Keeper of Secrets[[/col]] before its corruption threatens the Great Vortex.

<dummy>The motives of each Council of Thirteen member are forever shrouded in secrecy - most of all, the Grand Nightlord of Clan Eshin. Yet Deathmaster Snikch is on the move, dispatched by his master to search for a sinister source of [[col:ancillary_unique]]immense power[[/col]] deep in the heart of Grand Cathay.

<dummy>A delegation from Skavenblight has arrived to petition Clan Eshin for their services. Representatives from each of the Great Clans are present, as well as a representative from the Council of Thirteen itself. As a show of strength, Snick orders his Assassins to bring him the [[col:red]]severed heads[[/col]] of thirteen Cathyan nobles.

<dummy>In the overpopulated metropolises of Grand Cathay, Clan Eshin has thrived. Over the centuries, their labyrinthine under-cities have gnawed away at the foundations of the nation and now threaten to devour them entirely. At the heart of Skavenblight, Nightlord Sneek declares to all of Skavendom that the Age of Dragons has ended, and the Year of the Rat has begun.

<dummy>A towering, black-furred Skaven steps forth, clad in the crimson regalia of Clan Mors. He seeks the assassination of the Master Artificer of Nan-Gau so that the Skaven can seize the [[col:yellow]]forges[[/col]] there and retask them to producing superior arms and armour for the Stormvermin.

<dummy>A Packmaster limps forward, his scarred body testament to a lifetime of wrangling countless savage beasts. He informs the Deathmaster that his master, Throt the Unclean, has taken a special interest in the [[col:subtitle_vilitch]]Curseling[[/col]]'s fused flesh and wishes to obtain his corpse for experimentation.

<dummy>A heavily burned Skaven proffers a tightly-bound scroll in his mechanical hand. He explains it is the location of known [[col:ancillary_uncommon]]warpstone deposits[[/col]] scattered across Cathay's western deserts. If Eshin's warriors could lay low the Cathayan's bastion in the region, Clan Skryre is willing to commit their technical ingenuity to the mining operations, provided they receive a sizeable cut of the profits, of course.

<dummy>A stooped Skaven lowers his hood to reveal a hideous visage marred with weeping sores and calcified flesh. The Plague Rat seeks the death of a [[col:ancillary_crafted]]fearsome reptile[[/col]] that currently prowls Cathay's southern jungles. He claims it is a simple matter of vengeance, if that can be believed.

<dummy>An imperious Grey Seer approaches, horned head raised high. He declares that the time has come for Clan Eshin to rise up and take the [[col:fe_white]]Celestial City[[/col]] from its draconic masters. It is a bold goal, but arguably suicidal. Snikch knows that such a plan will have no hope of success unless Cathay's greatest defenders are taken off the board.

<dummy>Dire news reaches Slayer Keep. Garagrim Ironfist, heir apparent and War-Mourner of Karak Kadrin, is dead. Grief and rage mingle together, a bitter brew that Ungrim knows all too well. Swearing oaths of vengeance, he gathers a mighty host to his banner and sets forth into the mountains.

<dummy>Word has come from Karaz-a-Karak, warning of grave danger from the east. The Dawi-Zharr, traitor-kin to the Karaz Ankor, have begun digging deep into the heart of the earth. They seek to muster the terrible power of their dark god and unleash it upon their enemies. To slay a fellow Dawi is a terrible crime, but the fate of the world is at stake. Taking up his axe, the Slayer King begs the Ancestors for forgiveness before leading his throng into the [[col:dark_r]]Dark Lands[[/col]].

<dummy>Though the Dwarfs of Norsca were isolated from their southern brethren for many years, recent diplomatic efforts by the High King have brought them back into the fold. Yet many threats occupy Thorgrim's attention, and so he has entrusted the Slayer King to journey to the [[col:subtitle_miao_ying]]Silver Hall[[/col]] in his stead, where a formal reunification ceremony will take place. As a show of strength and goodwill, Ungrim means to arrive bearing gifts: the severed heads of their enemies!

<dummy>As the first true Vampire Count, Vlad has designs not only to create a realm of the dead, but also to secure dominion over the living. Together with his wife, Isabella, he wages war against the Empire, for he truly believes he has a legitimate claim to the throne.

<dummy>Vlad's ambitions turn eastward, to the lands of the Dwarfs. Beneath their bastions of stone, an untouched realm of ancient treasure vaults and burial tombs lies concealed. These chambers are sealed with potent runic wards, safeguarding their honoured dead and the glittering treasure hoards within. For the von Carsteins, such spoils are too tempting to ignore.

<dummy>[[col:subtitle_valkia]]Kattarin the Bloody[[/col]] once ruled Kislev as its tzarina before she was ousted from the throne and staked through the heart by her great-great-grandson, Tsaravich Pavel. Her corpse, frozen in a block of ice, is still on display at [[col:subtitle_katarin]]Bokha Palace[[/col]], much to the chagrin of the Midnight Aristocracy. Upon learning of this tale, Isabella was outraged. She has vowed to punish the Kislevites for their temerity, though others suspect she merely wishes to see the [[col:subtitle_katarin]]Ice Queen[[/col]] dead, for her cold beauty is rumoured to rival Isabella's own...

<dummy>Whilst the Phoenix King Finubar remains ensconced in the highest tower of Lothern, Alarielle commands the Glittering Host's many armies in his stead. Not whilst she still draws breath will she allow the Ten Kingdoms to fall.

<dummy>Across the Great Ocean, tainted creatures spread their corruption, planting a seed of pure evil into Isha's weakening heart. Thunder roars across the hills of Avelorn as the Everqueen senses her goddess' torment. She will not stand idle. The Asur will stride beyond Ulthuan's borders and bring ruin to those who would threaten the sanctity of this world.

<dummy>The Treeman Oakheart emerges from the worldroots and petitions the Everqueen for aid. Despite their best efforts, the [[col:subtitle_kairos_past]]Queen of the Woods[[/col]], [[col:subtitle_kairos_past]]Ariel[[/col]], remains hopelessly tainted by the blight of Chaos, and her corruption will soon threaten the [[col:subtitle_kairos_past]]Oak of Ages[[/col]] itself. Isha's chosen must journey to the forests and garner the support of the fey folk before moving against Isha's avatar directly.

<dummy>At the heart of his icy labyrinth, the Wintertooth rises from his rocky throne. His Monstrous Horde, now bolstered with tribes of savage Norscans, stands ready to bring ruin in the name of their slavering liege. The skies darken, promising a fierce ice-shard blizzard soon to come. Taking up his hammer, Throgg leads his subjects into the coming storm.\\n\\n

<dummy>Every season, great and lauded heroes brave Throgg's lair, and every season, the Troll King dines upon their flesh. Yet he grows weary of these constant trespasses upon his lands. Vowing to the Dark Gods that he will see the lands of men despoiled, he gathers his nightmarish horde of monsters, mutants and madmen and leads them deep into the so-called civilised lands of the south.\\n\\n

<dummy>Colonies of disparate Trolls can be found throughout the Old World. Some fight in service of warmongering Greenskins. Others live a pitiful existence hiding from the merciless blades of Dwarfs and Men. Throgg seeks to liberate them all, for he is their king, and what sort of king does not defend his people?\\n\\n

<dummy>The Shadow King leads a punitive expedition into [[col:ancillary_unique]]Naggaroth[[/col]], intent on ending the [[col:ancillary_unique]]Witch King[[/col]]'s life forever. Thanks to support from the Phoenix King, his guerrilla raids have since escalated into all-out conquest. He will not cease his campaign until [[col:ancillary_unique]]Malekith[[/col]] is dead and the Druchii's great cities are in ruins.

<dummy>While resting in a moonlit glade, the Shadow King is approached by an apparition of Lileath, the goddess of dreams and fortune. She reveals that the [[col:subtitle_kairos_future]]Amulet of Sunfire[[/col]], once lost beneath the waves, has been found by a Black Ark Corsair who has now gone into hiding somewhere in [[col:ancillary_unique]]Naggaroth[[/col]].

<dummy>“Do not long for peace, for there can be none while any Druchii still draw breath. Embrace war as the crucible of your valediction, the means to purge this stain upon our people. Swear oaths of vengeance, not to me or your companions or to the uncaring gods, but to fallen mothers and fathers, dead sisters and brothers, slain sons and daughters. Take the darkness that the Druchii have created and rob them of its power.”

<dummy>[[col:yellow]]Zarakzil[[/col]] is beset by foes on all sides. The Exile King knows that the modest hold cannot withstand these threats alone. Standing atop his Oathstone, he declares to all his kin that he would rather die in exile than see another hold suffer the same fate of Vala-Azril-Ungol. With hammer and shield, he swears to bring ruin to all who would threaten their people.

<dummy>The [[col:subtitle_miao_ying]]Grey Dwarfs[[/col]] are primarily the descendants of refugees from the broken holds of the Worlds Edge Mountains who now spend their days harvesting the meagre resources of the [[col:subtitle_miao_ying]]Grey Mountains[[/col]]. Belegar means to reignite their warrior spirit and unite them under the banner of Clan Angrund.

<dummy>To the west, foul grobi and uzkular raid and pillage the manlings of [[col:ancillary_rare]]Bretonnia[[/col]]. Though the stone from their shoddy castles could be put to far better use, perhaps it would be wiser to cut down their foes and win Clan Angrund a powerful, wealthy ally?

<dummy>The [[col:ancillary_uncommon]]Elves of Athel Loren[[/col]] and the [[col:ancillary_rare]]Dwarfs of the Karaz Ankor[[/col]] share a bloody history that stretches back centuries. Many think such grievances can only be avenged with axe and fire, but others argue it is time to make peace with the wutelgi and fight shoulder-to-shoulder against the common foe.

<dummy>The time is nigh for Clan Angrund to reclaim [[col:yellow]]Karak Eight Peaks[[/col]] from the Grobi and Thaggoraki despoilers! Belegar Ironhammer, clan leader and direct descendant of King Lunn, the last Dwarf to rule the ancestral hold, has inherited a bitter legacy of hatred and resentment. Even now he marshals his throng, making ready to strike out from Zarakzil. With the spirits of his fabled ancestors returned to fight by his side, Belegar will see his oaths fulfilled, and pass into legend himself.

<dummy>By the light of flickering candles made of Dwarf-fat, Skarsnik sits on his iron throne and plots yet more wicked schemes of conquest. [[col:yellow]]Mount Gunbad[[/col]] is his. [[col:yellow]]Karak Eight Peaks[[/col]] is his (those treasonous gits just don't know it yet). Why stop there? Why shouldn't all the mountains be his to rule? Why indeed?

<dummy>Skarsnik is concerned. His ever-present pet, the Giant Cave Squig named [[col:subtitle_valkia]]Gobbla[[/col]], looks a bit pale of late.
